lexUnit.name: brim.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the projecting edge around the bottom of a hat.

sentence.text: Looking at the upturned brim of Flora 's panama she decided not to ask .
He returned the mare to her loose-box and , coming out again , leaned against the closed door with his arm folded and regarded her steadily from beneath the dragged-down brim of his flat cap .
I had chips of brick on the brim of my fedora .
Dark eyes twinkle below the brim of the ubiquitous Honduran baseball cap , his compact campesino frame twisting this way and that to survey his little kingdom .
` He 'd tied a black scarf , or a stocking , or something over his face , and I could only see his eyes between that and his hat brim .
He touched his whip to his hat brim .
` All right now ? " the saviour-of-the-day adjusts her mirror-lensed sunglasses , yanks down her hat brim , shrugs off the gratitude laconically .
This was shown with a large round lace hat brim , on a cream satin band .
Braden 's pointed hat brim moved up and down .
He marched to the door , followed by Horowitz who put his soft trilby back on his head , pulling the brim down .
Gerbier , for instance , says on window design that they “ must be as high again as wyde … ” and that their mouldings needed “ the broad brim of a good hat to a travaileur on a rainy day ” .
The same blue as her taffeta gown , the deep brim lined with tiny , ruched frills on the underside , a huge bow at the back with waist-length streamers stitched with tiny blue and white beads .
It had a wide brim and a small ventilation hole in the top like a chimney .
A face that wore dark glasses and was shadowed by the wide brim of a flat black hat .
Little flames were breaking through the brim of Charlie 's straw hat .
She slapped her knees as an old man might , tipped up the brim of her hat and laughed a long chuckling laugh .
The Doctor adjusted the brim of his hat to shadow his eyes .
